result.execSummary:
All charges against Jerrad A Houston in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jerrad A Houston is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jerrad A Houston

records.addlTxt:
CASE RECALLED LATER THE SAME MORNING: 
State moves to dismiss for lack of cooperative witness.  Court ordered case dismissed.

CASE RECALLED LATER THE SAME MORNING: 
Defendant Jerrad A Houston in court.  Attorney Matthew V Plummer in court for Jerrad A Houston.  Prosecuting attorney Michael J. Odden in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Jury trial second call.  Court will be in trial with another case.  Victim makes statement requesting the Court drop the no contact order.  Defendant objects and wants the no contact order to remain in effect. Victim abruptly leaves the courtroom stating she is done.

 Case is adjourned for a possible spin.

Defendant Jerrad A Houston in court.  Attorney Matthew V Plummer in court for Jerrad A Houston.  Prosecuting attorney Michael J. Odden in court for the State of Wisconsin
Jury trial first call.  State and defense are in jury trial posture.  Case is passed.

Defendant Jerrad A Houston in court with attorney Matthew V Plummer.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Final pretrial proceeded.  State's offer stated on the record.  Defense rejects State's offer.  Case remains in jury trial posture.  Case is adjourned to 9-19-22 at 8:30 am for Jury Trial.

Defendant Jerrad A Houston in court with attorney Matthew V Plummer.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defense is requesting final pretrial and jury trial dates. Case is adjourned to 8-17-22 at 8:30 am for final pretrial and 9-19-22 at 8:30 am for jury trial.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jerrad A Houston in court with attorney Matthew V Plummer.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
Parties are still negotiating and requesting a status conference hearing date.  Case is adjourned to 7-21-22 at 1:30 pm for status conference.
  This hearing may be streamed live on DAcast at the discretion of the Court:
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616  Status conference scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jerrad A Houston in court with attorney Matthew V Plummer.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jerrad A Houston appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Pretrial Conference held.  Defense counsel was recently appointed and requests additional time.  Case adjourned, Br. 10.  Status conference scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.
DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON (4/27/2022). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with D.M.Y. and D.M.H.
No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Jerrad A Houston in court.  Karen Lynch Vespalec appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 10 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 04/25/2022 @ 02;00pm
